intro: Chaetogastra microdon, commonly known as the small-haired grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family, characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
